item.title: Anthropocene
item.description: Climate change scientists proposed use of this term at the start of the millennium and adopted it in 2016. There has been pushback, however, with anthropologists and philosophers claiming it limits the conversation and misplaces the blame, failing to account for the political and economic systems that drive our destructive practices.

item.title: Capitalism cannot solve the climate crisis
item.description: Capitalism as an economic system cannot solve the climate crisis. Relying on production and consumption to ‚Äúfix‚Äù the consequences of our production and consumption can only exacerbate the crisis.

item.title: Time
item.description: The Greeks had two different conceptions of time: chronos (quantitative, linear) and kairos (qualitative, nonlinear). Ancient Indians had a similar conception of time: kala (quantitative) and ritu (qualitative).
